abstract: A weak night for the only credible nominee on stage.
snippet: A weak night for the only credible nominee on stage.
lead_paragraph: In a sense, last night's Republican debate went badly for Mitt Romney. When you're the clear frontrunner and the candidate who was supposed to provide your chief competition has spent the last month self-destructing, you have no business allowing yourself to get nettled by him - much less put your hand on his shoulder, talk over him angrily, mock his poor showings at previous debates, and complain at length that he's breaking the debate's rules of order. Nate Silver has the right take on the heated Romney-Rick Perry exchange:
